intro: Seriphium nervigerum, commonly known as the narrow-veined horseweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to North America and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have prominent veins, giving it its scientific name. Seriphium nervigerum is an annual or biennial plant that plays a role in pollination and soil stabilization in its native range.
